401 DOCTEST_INTERFACE extern bool is_running_in_test;

403 // A 24 byte string class (can be as small as 17 for x64 and 13 for x86) that can hold strings with length
404 // of up to 23 chars on the stack before going on the heap - the last byte of the buffer is used for:
405 // - "is small" bit - the highest bit - if "0" then it is small - otherwise its "1" (128)
406 // - if small - capacity left before going on the heap - using the lowest 5 bits
407 // - if small - 2 bits are left unused - the second and third highest ones
408 // - if small - acts as a null terminator if strlen() is 23 (24 including the null terminator)
409 // and the "is small" bit remains "0" ("as well as the capacity left") so its OK
410 // Idea taken from this lecture about the string implementation of facebook/folly - fbstring
411 // https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kPR8h4-qZdk
412 // TODO:
413 // - optimizations - like not deleting memory unnecessarily in operator= and etc.
414 // - resize/reserve/clear
415 // - substr
416 // - replace
417 // - back/front
418 // - iterator stuff
419 // - find & friends
420 // - push_back/pop_back
421 // - assign/insert/erase
422 // - relational operators as free functions - taking const char* as one of the params
423 class DOCTEST_INTERFACE String
424 {
425  static const unsigned len = 24;
426  static const unsigned last = len - 1;
427 
428  struct view // len should be more than sizeof(view) - because of the final byte for flags
429  {
430  char* ptr;
431  unsigned size;
432  unsigned capacity;
433  };
434 
435  union
436  {
437  char buf[len];
438  view data;
439  };
440 
441  bool isOnStack() const { return (buf[last] & 128) == 0; }
442  void setOnHeap();
443  void setLast(unsigned in = last);
444 
445  void copy(const String& other);
446 
447 public:
448  String();
449  ~String();
450 
451  String(const char* in);
452 
453  String(const String& other);
454  String& operator=(const String& other);
455 
456  String& operator+=(const String& other);
457  String operator+(const String& other) const;
458 
459  String(String&& other);
460  String& operator=(String&& other);
461 
462  char operator[](unsigned i) const;
463  char& operator[](unsigned i);
464 
465  // the only functions I'm willing to leave in the interface - available for inlining
466  const char* c_str() const { return const_cast<String*>(this)->c_str(); } // NOLINT
467  char* c_str() {
468  if(isOnStack())
469  return reinterpret_cast<char*>(buf);
470  return data.ptr;
471  }
472 
473  unsigned size() const;
474  unsigned capacity() const;
475 
476  int compare(const char* other, bool no_case = false) const;
477  int compare(const String& other, bool no_case = false) const;
478 };

483 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator>(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
484 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator<=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);

706 struct ContextOptions
707 {
708  // == parameters from the command line
709  String order_by; // how tests should be ordered
710  unsigned rand_seed; // the seed for rand ordering
711 
712  unsigned first; // the first (matching) test to be executed
713  unsigned last; // the last (matching) test to be executed
714 
715  int abort_after; // stop tests after this many failed assertions
716  int subcase_filter_levels; // apply the subcase filters for the first N levels
717 
718  bool success; // include successful assertions in output
719  bool case_sensitive; // if filtering should be case sensitive
720  bool exit; // if the program should be exited after the tests are ran/whatever
721  bool duration; // print the time duration of each test case
722  bool no_throw; // to skip exceptions-related assertion macros
723  bool no_exitcode; // if the framework should return 0 as the exitcode
724  bool no_run; // to not run the tests at all (can be done with an "*" exclude)
725  bool no_version; // to not print the version of the framework
726  bool no_colors; // if output to the console should be colorized
727  bool force_colors; // forces the use of colors even when a tty cannot be detected
728  bool no_breaks; // to not break into the debugger
729  bool no_skip; // don't skip test cases which are marked to be skipped
730  bool gnu_file_line; // if line numbers should be surrounded with :x: and not (x):
731  bool no_path_in_filenames; // if the path to files should be removed from the output
732  bool no_line_numbers; // if source code line numbers should be omitted from the output
733  bool no_skipped_summary; // don't print "skipped" in the summary !!! UNDOCUMENTED !!!
734 
735  bool help; // to print the help
736  bool version; // to print the version
737  bool count; // if only the count of matching tests is to be retreived
738  bool list_test_cases; // to list all tests matching the filters
739  bool list_test_suites; // to list all suites matching the filters
740  bool list_reporters; // lists all registered reporters
741 
742  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(ContextOptions);
743  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(ContextOptions);
744 };

880 class DOCTEST_INTERFACE Approx
881 {
882 public:
883  explicit Approx(double value);
884 
885  DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(Approx);
886 
887  Approx operator()(double value) const;
888 
889 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
890  template <typename T>
891  explicit Approx(const T& value,
892  typename detail::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type* =
893  static_cast<T*>(nullptr)) {
894  *this = Approx(static_cast<double>(value));
895  }
896 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
897 
898  Approx& epsilon(double newEpsilon);
899 
900 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
901  template <typename T>
902  typename detail::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, Approx&>::type epsilon(
903  const T& newEpsilon) {
904  m_epsilon = static_cast<double>(newEpsilon);
905  return *this;
906  }
907 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
908 
909  Approx& scale(double newScale);
910 
911 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
912  template <typename T>
913  typename detail::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, Approx&>::type scale(
914  const T& newScale) {
915  m_scale = static_cast<double>(newScale);
916  return *this;
917  }
918 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
919 
920  // clang-format off
921  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator==(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
922  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator==(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
923  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator!=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
924  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator!=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
925  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator<=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
926  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator<=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
927  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator>=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
928  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator>=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
929  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator< (double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
930  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator< (const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
931  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator> (double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
932  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator> (const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
933 
934  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend String toString(const Approx& in);
935 
936 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
937 #define DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX \
938  template <typename T> friend typename detail::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, bool>::type
939 
940  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator==(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return operator==(double(lhs), rhs); }
941  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator==(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return operator==(rhs, lhs); }
942  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator!=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return !operator==(lhs, rhs); }
943  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator!=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return !operator==(rhs, lhs); }
944  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator<=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return double(lhs) < rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
945  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator<=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value < double(rhs) || lhs == rhs; }
946  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator>=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return double(lhs) > rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
947  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator>=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value > double(rhs) || lhs == rhs; }
948  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator< (const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return double(lhs) < rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
949  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator< (const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value < double(rhs) && lhs != rhs; }
950  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator> (const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return double(lhs) > rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
951  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator> (const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value > double(rhs) && lhs != rhs; }
952 #undef DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX
953 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
954 
955  // clang-format on
956 
957 private:
958  double m_epsilon;
959  double m_scale;
960  double m_value;
961 };

1006  template <typename L, typename R>
1007  String stringifyBinaryExpr(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, const char* op,
1008  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
1009  return toString(lhs) + op + toString(rhs);
1010  }
1011 
1012 #define DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(op, op_str, op_macro) \
1013  template <typename R> \
1014  DOCTEST_NOINLINE Result operator op(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) { \
1015  bool res = op_macro(lhs, rhs); \
1016  if(m_at & assertType::is_false) \
1017  res = !res; \
1018  if(!res || doctest::getContextOptions()->success) \
1019  return Result(res, stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, op_str, rhs)); \
1020  return Result(res); \
1021  }
1022 
1023 #define DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(rt, op) \
1024  template <typename R> \
1025  rt& operator op(const R&) { \
1026  static_assert(deferred_false<R>::value, \
1027  "Expression Too Complex Please Rewrite As Binary Comparison!"); \
1028  return *this; \
1029  }
1030 
1031  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Result
1032  {
1033  bool m_passed;
1034  String m_decomp;
1035 
1036  Result(bool passed, const String& decomposition = String());
1037 
1038  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(Result);
1039  DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(Result);
1040 
1041  // forbidding some expressions based on this table: http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/operator_precedence
1042  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &)
1043  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ^)
1044  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, |)
1045  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &&)
1046  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ||)
1047  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ==)
1048  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, !=)
1049  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <)
1050  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >)
1051  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <=)
1052  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >=)
1053  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, =)
1054  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, +=)
1055  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, -=)
1056  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, *=)
1057  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, /=)
1058  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, %=)
1059  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <<=)
1060  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >>=)
1061  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &=)
1062  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ^=)
1063  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, |=)

1108  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) { \
1109  return lhs op rhs; \

1135  template <typename L>
1136  // cppcheck-suppress copyCtorAndEqOperator
1137  struct Expression_lhs
1138  {
1139  L lhs;
1140  assertType::Enum m_at;
1141 
1142  explicit Expression_lhs(L in, assertType::Enum at)
1143  : lhs(in)
1144  , m_at(at) {}
1145 
1146  DOCTEST_NOINLINE operator Result() {
1147  bool res = !!lhs;
1148  if(m_at & assertType::is_false)
1149  res = !res;
1150 
1151  if(!res || getContextOptions()->success)
1152  return Result(res, toString(lhs));
1153  return Result(res);
1154  }
1155 
1156  // clang-format off
1157  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(==, " == ", DOCTEST_CMP_EQ)
1158  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(!=, " != ", DOCTEST_CMP_NE)
1159  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(>, " > ", DOCTEST_CMP_GT)
1160  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(<, " < ", DOCTEST_CMP_LT)
1161  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(>=, " >= ", DOCTEST_CMP_GE)
1162  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(<=, " <= ", DOCTEST_CMP_LE)
1163  // clang-format on
1164 
1165  // forbidding some expressions based on this table: http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/operator_precedence
1166  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &)
1167  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ^)
1168  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, |)
1169  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &&)
1170  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ||)
1171  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, =)
1172  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, +=)
1173  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, -=)
1174  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, *=)
1175  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, /=)
1176  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, %=)
1177  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, <<=)
1178  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, >>=)
1179  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &=)
1180  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ^=)
1181  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, |=)
1182  // these 2 are unfortunate because they should be allowed - they have higher precedence over the comparisons, but the
1183  // ExpressionDecomposer class uses the left shift operator to capture the left operand of the binary expression...
1184  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, <<)
1185  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, >>)
1186  };

1205  // The right operator for capturing expressions is "<=" instead of "<<" (based on the operator precedence table)
1206  // but then there will be warnings from GCC about "-Wparentheses" and since "_Pragma()" is problematic this will stay for now...
1207  // https://github.com/philsquared/Catch/issues/870
1208  // https://github.com/philsquared/Catch/issues/565
1209  template <typename L>
1210  Expression_lhs<const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L)> operator<<(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) operand) {
1211  return Expression_lhs<const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L)>(operand, m_at);
1212  }
1213  };

1310  template <int comparison, typename L, typename R>
1311  DOCTEST_NOINLINE void binary_assert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs,
1312  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
1313  m_failed = !RelationalComparator<comparison, L, R>()(lhs, rhs);
1314  if(m_failed || getContextOptions()->success)
1315  m_decomp = stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs);
1316  }
1317 
1318  template <typename L>
1319  DOCTEST_NOINLINE void unary_assert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) val) {
1320  m_failed = !val;
1321 
1322  if(m_at & assertType::is_false)
1323  m_failed = !m_failed;
1324 
1325  if(m_failed || getContextOptions()->success)
1326  m_decomp = toString(val);
1327  }
1328 
1329  void unexpectedExceptionOccurred();
1330 
1331  bool log();
1332  void react() const;
1333  };

1335  namespace assertAction {
1336  enum Enum
1337  {
1338  nothing = 0,
1339  dbgbreak = 1,
1340  shouldthrow = 2
1341  };
1342  } // namespace assertAction
1343 
1344 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
1345 #define DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_REACT \
1346  do { \
1347  if(res & assertAction::dbgbreak) \
1348  DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER(); \
1349  fastAssertThrowIfFlagSet(res); \
1350  } while(false)
1351 #define DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_RETURN(x) return
1352 #define DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_RETURN_TYPE void
1353 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
1354 #define DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_REACT return res
1355 #define DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_RETURN(x) return x
1356 #define DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_RETURN_TYPE int
1357 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
1358 
1359  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void failed_out_of_a_testing_context(const AssertData& ad);
1360 
1361 #define DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(decomp) \
1362  do { \
1363  if(!is_running_in_test) { \
1364  if(failed) { \
1365  ResultBuilder rb(at, file, line, expr); \
1366  rb.m_failed = failed; \
1367  rb.m_decomp = decomp; \
1368  failed_out_of_a_testing_context(rb); \
1369  int res = checkIfShouldThrow(at) ? assertAction::shouldthrow : 0; \
1370  res |= (isDebuggerActive() && !getContextOptions()->no_breaks) ? \
1371  assertAction::dbgbreak : \
1372  0; \
1373  DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_REACT; \
1374  } \
1375  DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_RETURN(0); \
1376  } \
1377  } while(false)
1378 
1379 #define DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(decomp) \
1380  ResultBuilder rb(at, file, line, expr); \
1381  rb.m_failed = failed; \
1382  if(rb.m_failed || getContextOptions()->success) \
1383  rb.m_decomp = decomp; \
1384  int res = rb.log() ? assertAction::dbgbreak : 0; \
1385  if(rb.m_failed && checkIfShouldThrow(at)) \
1386  res |= assertAction::shouldthrow; \
1387  DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_REACT
1388 
1389  template <int comparison, typename L, typename R>
1390  DOCTEST_NOINLINE DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_RETURN_TYPE
1391  fast_binary_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
1392  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
1393  bool failed = !RelationalComparator<comparison, L, R>()(lhs, rhs);
1394 
1395  // ###################################################################################
1396  // IF THE DEBUGGER BREAKS HERE - GO 1 LEVEL UP IN THE CALLSTACK FOR THE FAILING ASSERT
1397  // THIS IS THE EFFECT OF HAVING 'DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS' DEFINED
1398  // ###################################################################################
1399  DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs));
1400  DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs));
1401  }
1402 
1403  template <typename L>
1404  DOCTEST_NOINLINE DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_RETURN_TYPE fast_unary_assert(assertType::Enum at,
1405  const char* file, int line,
1406  const char* expr,
1407  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L)
1408  val) {
1409  bool failed = !val;
1410 
1411  if(at & assertType::is_false)
1412  failed = !failed;
1413 
1414  // ###################################################################################
1415  // IF THE DEBUGGER BREAKS HERE - GO 1 LEVEL UP IN THE CALLSTACK FOR THE FAILING ASSERT
1416  // THIS IS THE EFFECT OF HAVING 'DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS' DEFINED
1417  // ###################################################################################
1418  DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(toString(val));
1419  DOCTEST_FAST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(toString(val));
1420  }

1431  template <typename T>
1432  class ExceptionTranslator : public IExceptionTranslator
1433  {
1434  public:
1435  explicit ExceptionTranslator(String (*translateFunction)(T))
1436  : m_translateFunction(translateFunction) {}
1437 
1438  bool translate(String& res) const {
1439 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1440  try {
1441  throw;
1442  // cppcheck-suppress catchExceptionByValue
1443  } catch(T ex) { // NOLINT
1444  res = m_translateFunction(ex);
1445  return true;
1446  } catch(...) {}
1447 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1448  ((void)res); // to silence -Wunused-parameter
1449  return false;
1450  }
1451 
1452  private:
1453  String (*m_translateFunction)(T);
1454  };

1528  {
1529  const T* capture;

1536  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Chunk
1537  {
1538  char buf[sizeof(Capture<char>)] DOCTEST_ALIGNMENT(
1539  2 * sizeof(void*)); // place to construct a Capture<T>
1540 
1541  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(Chunk);
1542  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(Chunk);
1543  };
1544 
1545  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Node
1546  {
1547  Chunk chunk;
1548  Node* next;
1549 
1550  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(Node);
1551  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(Node);
1552  };
1553 
1554  Chunk stackChunks[DOCTEST_CONFIG_NUM_CAPTURES_ON_STACK];
1555  int numCaptures = 0;
1556  Node* head = nullptr;
1557  Node* tail = nullptr;
1558 
1559  ContextBuilder(ContextBuilder& other);
1560 
1561  ContextBuilder& operator=(const ContextBuilder&) = delete;
1562 
1563  void stringify(std::ostream* s) const;
1564 
1565  public:
1566  ContextBuilder();
1567  ~ContextBuilder();
1568 
1569  template <typename T>
1570  DOCTEST_NOINLINE ContextBuilder& operator<<(T& in) {
1571  Capture<T> temp(&in);
1572 
1573  // construct either on stack or on heap
1574  // copy the bytes for the whole object - including the vtable because we cant construct
1575  // the object directly in the buffer using placement new - need the <new> header...
1576  if(numCaptures < DOCTEST_CONFIG_NUM_CAPTURES_ON_STACK) {
1577  my_memcpy(stackChunks[numCaptures].buf, &temp, sizeof(Chunk));
1578  } else {
1579  auto curr = new Node;
1580  curr->next = nullptr;
1581  if(tail) {
1582  tail->next = curr;
1583  tail = curr;
1584  } else {
1585  head = tail = curr;
1586  }
1587 
1588  my_memcpy(tail->chunk.buf, &temp, sizeof(Chunk));
1589  }
1590  ++numCaptures;
1591  return *this;
1592  }
1593 
1594  template <typename T>
1595  ContextBuilder& operator<<(const T&&) {
1596  static_assert(deferred_false<T>::value,
1597  "Cannot pass temporaries or rvalues to the streaming operator because it "
1598  "caches pointers to the passed objects for lazy evaluation!");
1599  return *this;
1600  }
1601  };

1638 #define DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(name, type, def) \
1639  struct name \
1640  { \
1641  type data; \
1642  name(type in = def) \
1643  : data(in) {} \
1644  void fill(detail::TestCase& state) const { state.DOCTEST_CAT(m_, name) = data; } \
1645  void fill(detail::TestSuite& state) const { state.DOCTEST_CAT(m_, name) = data; } \
1646  }

1654 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(expected_failures, int, 0);

1657 int registerExceptionTranslator(String (*translateFunction)(T)) {
1658  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wexit-time-destructors")
1659  static detail::ExceptionTranslator<T> exceptionTranslator(translateFunction);
1660  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
1661  detail::registerExceptionTranslatorImpl(&exceptionTranslator);
1662  return 0;
1663 }

1715 namespace TestCaseFailureReason {
1716  enum Enum
1717  {
1718  None = 0,
1719  AssertFailure = 1, // an assertion has failed in the test case
1720  Exception = 2, // test case threw an exception
1721  Crash = 4, // a crash...
1722  TooManyFailedAsserts = 8, // the abort-after option
1723  Timeout = 16, // see the timeout decorator
1724  ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt = 32, // see the should_fail decorator
1725  ShouldHaveFailedAndDid = 64, // see the should_fail decorator
1726  DidntFailExactlyNumTimes = 128, // see the expected_failures decorator
1727  FailedExactlyNumTimes = 256, // see the expected_failures decorator
1728  CouldHaveFailedAndDid = 512 // see the may_fail decorator
1729  };
1730 } // namespace TestCaseFailureReason

1732 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE CurrentTestCaseStats
1733 {
1734  int numAssertsForCurrentTestCase;
1735  int numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase;
1736  double seconds_so_far;
1737  int failure_flags; // use TestCaseFailureReason::Enum
1738  String error_string;
1739  bool should_reenter; // means we are not done with the test case because of subcases
1740 
1741  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(CurrentTestCaseStats);
1742  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(CurrentTestCaseStats);
1743 };

1745 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestRunStats
1746 {
1747  unsigned numTestCases;
1748  unsigned numTestCasesPassingFilters;
1749  unsigned numTestSuitesPassingFilters;
1750  unsigned numTestCasesFailed;
1751  int numAsserts;
1752  int numAssertsFailed;

1755  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(TestRunStats);

1757 
1758 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE IReporter
1759 {
1760  // called when the whole test run starts (safe to cache a pointer to the input)
1761  virtual void test_run_start(const ContextOptions&) = 0;
1762  // called when the whole test run ends (caching a pointer to the input doesn't make sense here)
1763  virtual void test_run_end(const TestRunStats&) = 0;
1764 
1765  // called when a test case is started (safe to cache a pointer to the input)
1766  virtual void test_case_start(const TestCaseData&) = 0;
1767  // called when a test case has ended - could be re-entered if more subcases have to be
1768  // traversed - check CurrentTestCaseStats::should_reenter (caching a pointer to the input doesn't make sense here)
1769  virtual void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats&) = 0;
1770 
1771  // called whenever a subcase is entered (don't cache pointers to the input)
1772  virtual void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature&) = 0;
1773  // called whenever a subcase is exited (don't cache pointers to the input)
1774  virtual void subcase_end(const SubcaseSignature&) = 0;
1775 
1776  // called for each assert (don't cache pointers to the input)
1777  virtual void log_assert(const AssertData&) = 0;
1778  // called for each message (don't cache pointers to the input)
1779  virtual void log_message(const MessageData&) = 0;
1780 
1781  // called when a test case is skipped either because it doesn't pass the filters, has a skip decorator
1782  // or isn't in the execution range (between first and last) (safe to cache a pointer to the input)
1783  virtual void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) = 0;
1784 
1785  // doctest will not be managing the lifetimes of reporters given to it but this would still be nice to have
1786  virtual ~IReporter();
1787 
1788  // can obtain all currently active contexts and stringify them if one wishes to do so
1789  static int get_num_active_contexts();
1790  static const IContextScope* const* get_active_contexts();
1791 
1792  // can iterate through contexts which have been stringified automatically in their destructors when an exception has been thrown
1793  static int get_num_stringified_contexts();
1794  static const String* get_stringified_contexts();
1795 };
1796 
1797 int registerReporter(const char* name, int priority, IReporter& r);
1798 
1799 } // namespace doctest

1876 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE_IMPL(dec, T, id, anon) \
1877  template <typename T> \
1878  inline void anon(); \
1879  template <typename Type, typename... Rest> \
1880  struct DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR) \
1881  { \
1882  DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR)(int line, int index) { \
1883  DOCTEST_REGISTER_TYPED_TEST_CASE_IMPL(anon<Type>, Type, dec, line * 1000 + index); \
1884  DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR)<Rest...>(line, index + 1); \
1885  } \
1886  }; \

1888  struct DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR)<Type> \
1889  { \
1890  DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR)(int line, int index) { \
1891  DOCTEST_REGISTER_TYPED_TEST_CASE_IMPL(anon<Type>, Type, dec, line * 1000 + index); \
1892  } \
1893  }

2048 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS(expr, assert_type) \
2049  do { \
2050  if(!doctest::getContextOptions()->no_throw) { \
2051  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2052  __LINE__, #expr); \
2053  try { \
2054  expr; \
2055  } catch(...) { _DOCTEST_RB.m_threw = true; } \
2056  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB); \
2057  } \
2058  } while((void)0, 0)
2059 
2060 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, assert_type, ...) \
2061  do { \
2062  if(!doctest::getContextOptions()->no_throw) { \
2063  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2064  __LINE__, #expr, #__VA_ARGS__); \
2065  try { \
2066  expr; \
2067  } catch(const __VA_ARGS__&) { \
2068  _DOCTEST_RB.m_threw = true; \
2069  _DOCTEST_RB.m_threw_as = true; \
2070  } catch(...) { _DOCTEST_RB.unexpectedExceptionOccurred(); } \
2071  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB); \
2072  } \
2073  } while((void)0, 0)
2074 
2075 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(expr, assert_type) \
2076  do { \
2077  if(!doctest::getContextOptions()->no_throw) { \
2078  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2079  __LINE__, #expr); \
2080  try { \
2081  expr; \
2082  } catch(...) { _DOCTEST_RB.unexpectedExceptionOccurred(); } \
2083  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB); \
2084  } \

2745  // case insensitive strcmp
2746  int stricmp(const char* a, const char* b) {
2747  for(;; a++, b++) {
2748  const int d = tolower(*a) - tolower(*b);
2749  if(d != 0 || !*a)
2750  return d;
2751  }
2752  }
2753 
2754  template <typename T>
2755  String fpToString(T value, int precision) {
2756  std::ostringstream oss;
2757  oss << std::setprecision(precision) << std::fixed << value;
2758  std::string d = oss.str();
2759  size_t i = d.find_last_not_of('0');
2760  if(i != std::string::npos && i != d.size() - 1) {
2761  if(d[i] == '.')
2762  i++;
2763  d = d.substr(0, i + 1);
2764  }
2765  return d.c_str();
2766  }
2767 
2768  struct Endianness
2769  {
2770  enum Arch
2771  {
2772  Big,
2773  Little
2774  };
2775 
2776  static Arch which() {
2777  union _
2778  {
2779  int asInt;
2780  char asChar[sizeof(int)];
2781  } u;
2782 
2783  u.asInt = 1; // NOLINT
2784  return (u.asChar[sizeof(int) - 1] == 1) ? Big : Little; // NOLINT
2785  }
2786  };
2787 } // namespace
2788 
2789 namespace detail {
2790  void my_memcpy(void* dest, const void* src, unsigned num) { memcpy(dest, src, num); }
2791 
2792  String rawMemoryToString(const void* object, unsigned size) {
2793  // Reverse order for little endian architectures
2794  int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>(size), inc = 1;
2795  if(Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little) {
2796  i = end - 1;
2797  end = inc = -1;
2798  }
2799 
2800  unsigned const char* bytes = static_cast<unsigned const char*>(object);
2801  std::ostringstream oss;
2802  oss << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
2803  for(; i != end; i += inc)
2804  oss << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
2805  return oss.str().c_str();
2806  }
2807 
2808  thread_local std::ostringstream g_oss;
2809 
2810  std::ostream* getTlsOss() {
2811  g_oss.clear(); // there shouldn't be anything worth clearing in the flags
2812  g_oss.str(""); // the slow way of resetting a string stream
2813  //g_oss.seekp(0); // optimal reset - as seen here: https://stackoverflow.com/a/624291/3162383
2814  return &g_oss;
2815  }
2816 
2817  String getTlsOssResult() {
2818  //g_oss << std::ends; // needed - as shown here: https://stackoverflow.com/a/624291/3162383
2819  return g_oss.str().c_str();
2820  }

2860 void String::setOnHeap() { *reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&buf[last]) = 128; }
2861 void String::setLast(unsigned in) { buf[last] = char(in); }
2862 
2863 void String::copy(const String& other) {
2864  if(other.isOnStack()) {
2865  memcpy(buf, other.buf, len);
2866  } else {
2867  setOnHeap();
2868  data.size = other.data.size;
2869  data.capacity = data.size + 1;
2870  data.ptr = new char[data.capacity];
2871  memcpy(data.ptr, other.data.ptr, data.size + 1);
2872  }
2873 }
2874 
2875 String::String() {
2876  buf[0] = '\0';
2877  setLast();
2878 }

2880 String::~String() {
2881  if(!isOnStack())
2882  delete[] data.ptr;
2883 }

2885 String::String(const char* in) {
2886  unsigned in_len = strlen(in);
2887  if(in_len <= last) {
2888  memcpy(buf, in, in_len + 1);
2889  setLast(last - in_len);
2890  } else {
2891  setOnHeap();
2892  data.size = in_len;
2893  data.capacity = data.size + 1;
2894  data.ptr = new char[data.capacity];
2895  memcpy(data.ptr, in, in_len + 1);
2896  }
2897 }

2900 
2901 String& String::operator=(const String& other) {
2902  if(this != &other) {
2903  if(!isOnStack())
2904  delete[] data.ptr;
2905 
2906  copy(other);
2907  }
2908 
2909  return *this;
2910 }
2911 
2912 String& String::operator+=(const String& other) {
2913  const unsigned my_old_size = size();
2914  const unsigned other_size = other.size();
2915  const unsigned total_size = my_old_size + other_size;
2916  if(isOnStack()) {
2917  if(total_size < len) {
2918  // append to the current stack space
2919  memcpy(buf + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
2920  setLast(last - total_size);
2921  } else {
2922  // alloc new chunk
2923  char* temp = new char[total_size + 1];
2924  // copy current data to new location before writing in the union
2925  memcpy(temp, buf, my_old_size); // skip the +1 ('\0') for speed
2926  // update data in union
2927  setOnHeap();
2928  data.size = total_size;
2929  data.capacity = data.size + 1;
2930  data.ptr = temp;
2931  // transfer the rest of the data
2932  memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
2933  }
2934  } else {
2935  if(data.capacity > total_size) {
2936  // append to the current heap block
2937  data.size = total_size;
2938  memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
2939  } else {
2940  // resize
2941  data.capacity *= 2;
2942  if(data.capacity <= total_size)
2943  data.capacity = total_size + 1;
2944  // alloc new chunk
2945  char* temp = new char[data.capacity];
2946  // copy current data to new location before releasing it
2947  memcpy(temp, data.ptr, my_old_size); // skip the +1 ('\0') for speed
2948  // release old chunk
2949  delete[] data.ptr;
2950  // update the rest of the union members
2951  data.size = total_size;
2952  data.ptr = temp;
2953  // transfer the rest of the data
2954  memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
2955  }
2956  }
2957 
2958  return *this;
2959 }
2960 
2961 String String::operator+(const String& other) const { return String(*this) += other; }
2962

3226 bool operator==(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) {
3227  // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining this formula
3228  return std::fabs(lhs - rhs.m_value) <
3229  rhs.m_epsilon * (rhs.m_scale + std::max(std::fabs(lhs), std::fabs(rhs.m_value)));
3230 }
3231 bool operator==(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return operator==(rhs, lhs); }
3232 bool operator!=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return !operator==(lhs, rhs); }
3233 bool operator!=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return !operator==(rhs, lhs); }
3234 bool operator<=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs < rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
3235 bool operator<=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value < rhs || lhs == rhs; }
3236 bool operator>=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs > rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
3237 bool operator>=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value > rhs || lhs == rhs; }

3387  // matching of a string against a wildcard mask (case sensitivity configurable) taken from
3388  // https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/1088/Wildcard-string-compare-globbing
3389  int wildcmp(const char* str, const char* wild, bool caseSensitive) {
3390  const char* cp = nullptr;
3391  const char* mp = nullptr;
3392 
3393  while((*str) && (*wild != '*')) {
3394  if((caseSensitive ? (*wild != *str) : (tolower(*wild) != tolower(*str))) &&
3395  (*wild != '?')) {
3396  return 0;
3397  }
3398  wild++;
3399  str++;
3400  }
3401 
3402  while(*str) {
3403  if(*wild == '*') {
3404  if(!*++wild) {
3405  return 1;
3406  }
3407  mp = wild;
3408  cp = str + 1;
3409  } else if((caseSensitive ? (*wild == *str) : (tolower(*wild) == tolower(*str))) ||
3410  (*wild == '?')) {
3411  wild++;
3412  str++;
3413  } else {
3414  wild = mp;
3415  str = cp++;
3416  }
3417  }
3418 
3419  while(*wild == '*') {
3420  wild++;
3421  }
3422  return !*wild;
3423  }
3424 
3426  //unsigned hashStr(unsigned const char* str) {
3427  // unsigned long hash = 5381;
3428  // char c;
3429  // while((c = *str++))
3430  // hash = ((hash << 5) + hash) + c; // hash * 33 + c
3431  // return hash;
3432  //}
3433 
3434  // checks if the name matches any of the filters (and can be configured what to do when empty)
3435  bool matchesAny(const char* name, const std::vector<String>& filters, bool matchEmpty,
3436  bool caseSensitive) {
3437  if(filters.empty() && matchEmpty)
3438  return true;
3439  for(auto& curr : filters)
3440  if(wildcmp(name, curr.c_str(), caseSensitive))
3441  return true;
3442  return false;
3443  }

3445 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
3446 
3447  typedef unsigned long long UInt64;
3448 
3449  UInt64 getCurrentTicks() {
3450  static UInt64 hz = 0, hzo = 0;
3451  if(!hz) {
3452  QueryPerformanceFrequency(reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>(&hz));
3453  QueryPerformanceCounter(reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>(&hzo));
3454  }
3455  UInt64 t;
3456  QueryPerformanceCounter(reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>(&t));
3457  return ((t - hzo) * 1000000) / hz;
3458  }
3459 #else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
3460 
3461  typedef uint64_t UInt64;
3462 
3463  UInt64 getCurrentTicks() {
3464  timeval t;
3465  gettimeofday(&t, nullptr);
3466  return static_cast<UInt64>(t.tv_sec) * 1000000 + static_cast<UInt64>(t.tv_usec);
3467  }
3468 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
3469 
3470  struct Timer
3471  {
3472  void start() { m_ticks = getCurrentTicks(); }
3473  unsigned int getElapsedMicroseconds() const {
3474  return static_cast<unsigned int>(getCurrentTicks() - m_ticks);
3475  }
3476  //unsigned int getElapsedMilliseconds() const {
3477  // return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds() / 1000);
3478  //}
3479  double getElapsedSeconds() const { return getElapsedMicroseconds() / 1000000.0; }
3480 
3481  private:
3482  UInt64 m_ticks = 0;
3483  };

3489  Subcase::Subcase(const char* name, const char* file, int line)
3490  : m_signature(name, file, line) {
3491  ContextState* s = g_cs;
3492 
3493  // if we have already completed it
3494  if(s->subcasesPassed.count(m_signature) != 0)
3495  return;
3496 
3497  // check subcase filters
3498  if(s->subcasesCurrentLevel < s->subcase_filter_levels) {
3499  if(!matchesAny(m_signature.m_name, s->filters[6], true, s->case_sensitive))
3500  return;
3501  if(matchesAny(m_signature.m_name, s->filters[7], false, s->case_sensitive))
3502  return;
3503  }
3504 
3505  // if a Subcase on the same level has already been entered
3506  if(s->subcasesEnteredLevels.count(s->subcasesCurrentLevel) != 0) {
3507  s->should_reenter = true;
3508  return;
3509  }
3510 
3511  s->subcasesEnteredLevels.insert(s->subcasesCurrentLevel++);
3512  m_entered = true;
3513 
3514  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_start, m_signature);
3515  }
3516 
3517  Subcase::~Subcase() {
3518  if(m_entered) {
3519  ContextState* s = g_cs;
3520 
3521  s->subcasesCurrentLevel--;
3522  // only mark the subcase as passed if no subcases have been skipped
3523  if(s->should_reenter == false)
3524  s->subcasesPassed.insert(m_signature);
3525 
3526  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_end, m_signature);
3527  }
3528  }
3529 
3530  Subcase::operator bool() const { return m_entered; }

3611  bool TestCase::operator<(const TestCase& other) const {
3612  if(m_line != other.m_line)
3613  return m_line < other.m_line;
3614  const int file_cmp = std::strcmp(m_file, other.m_file);
3615  if(file_cmp != 0)
3616  return file_cmp < 0;
3617  return m_template_id < other.m_template_id;
3618  }

3622  // for sorting tests by file/line
3623  int fileOrderComparator(const void* a, const void* b) {
3624  auto lhs = *static_cast<TestCase* const*>(a);
3625  auto rhs = *static_cast<TestCase* const*>(b);
3626 #if DOCTEST_MSVC
3627  // this is needed because MSVC gives different case for drive letters
3628  // for __FILE__ when evaluated in a header and a source file
3629  const int res = stricmp(lhs->m_file, rhs->m_file);
3630 #else // MSVC
3631  const int res = std::strcmp(lhs->m_file, rhs->m_file);
3632 #endif // MSVC
3633  if(res != 0)
3634  return res;
3635  return static_cast<int>(lhs->m_line - rhs->m_line);
3636  }
3637 
3638  // for sorting tests by suite/file/line
3639  int suiteOrderComparator(const void* a, const void* b) {
3640  auto lhs = *static_cast<TestCase* const*>(a);
3641  auto rhs = *static_cast<TestCase* const*>(b);
3642 
3643  const int res = std::strcmp(lhs->m_test_suite, rhs->m_test_suite);
3644  if(res != 0)
3645  return res;
3646  return fileOrderComparator(a, b);
3647  }
3648 
3649  // for sorting tests by name/suite/file/line
3650  int nameOrderComparator(const void* a, const void* b) {
3651  auto lhs = *static_cast<TestCase* const*>(a);
3652  auto rhs = *static_cast<TestCase* const*>(b);
3653 
3654  const int res_name = std::strcmp(lhs->m_name, rhs->m_name);
3655  if(res_name != 0)
3656  return res_name;
3657  return suiteOrderComparator(a, b);
3658  }

3689  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
3690  void color_to_stream(std::ostream& s, Color::Enum code) {
3691  ((void)s); // for DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE or DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3692  ((void)code); // for DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE
3693 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI
3694  if(g_no_colors ||
3695  (isatty(STDOUT_FILENO) == false && getContextOptions()->force_colors == false))
3696  return;
3697 
3698  auto col = "";
3699  // clang-format off
3700  switch(code) {
3701  case Color::Red: col = "[0;31m"; break;
3702  case Color::Green: col = "[0;32m"; break;
3703  case Color::Blue: col = "[0;34m"; break;
3704  case Color::Cyan: col = "[0;36m"; break;
3705  case Color::Yellow: col = "[0;33m"; break;
3706  case Color::Grey: col = "[1;30m"; break;
3707  case Color::LightGrey: col = "[0;37m"; break;
3708  case Color::BrightRed: col = "[1;31m"; break;
3709  case Color::BrightGreen: col = "[1;32m"; break;
3710  case Color::BrightWhite: col = "[1;37m"; break;
3711  case Color::Bright: // invalid
3712  case Color::None:
3713  case Color::White:
3714  default: col = "[0m";
3715  }
3716  // clang-format on
3717  s << "\033" << col;
3718 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI
3719 
3720 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3721  if(g_no_colors ||
3722  (isatty(fileno(stdout)) == false && getContextOptions()->force_colors == false))
3723  return;
3724 
3725 #define DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(x) SetConsoleTextAttribute(g_stdoutHandle, x | g_origBgAttrs)
3726 
3727  // clang-format off
3728  switch (code) {
3729  case Color::White: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
3730  case Color::Red: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_RED); break;
3731  case Color::Green: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
3732  case Color::Blue: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
3733  case Color::Cyan: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
3734  case Color::Yellow: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
3735  case Color::Grey: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(0); break;
3736  case Color::LightGrey: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY); break;
3737  case Color::BrightRed: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_RED); break;
3738  case Color::BrightGreen: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
3739  case Color::BrightWhite: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
3740  case Color::None:
3741  case Color::Bright: // invalid
3742  default: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(g_origFgAttrs);
3743  }
3744  // clang-format on
3745 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3746  }

3754  String translateActiveException() {
3755 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3756  String res;
3757  auto& translators = getExceptionTranslators();
3758  for(auto& curr : translators)
3759  if(curr->translate(res))
3760  return res;
3761  // clang-format off
3762  try {
3763  throw;
3764  } catch(std::exception& ex) {
3765  return ex.what();
3766  } catch(std::string& msg) {
3767  return msg.c_str();
3768  } catch(const char* msg) {
3769  return msg;
3770  } catch(...) {
3771  return "unknown exception";
3772  }
3773 // clang-format on
3774 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3775  return "";
3776 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3777  }

3793 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_MAC
3794  // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
3795  // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
3796  // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
3797  // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
3798  bool isDebuggerActive() {
3799  int mib[4];
3800  kinfo_proc info;
3801  size_t size;
3802  // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
3803  // reason, we get a predictable result.
3804  info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
3805  // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
3806  // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
3807  mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
3808  mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
3809  mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
3810  mib[3] = getpid();
3811  // Call sysctl.
3812  size = sizeof(info);
3813  if(sysctl(mib, DOCTEST_COUNTOF(mib), &info, &size, 0, 0) != 0) {
3814  fprintf(stderr, "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is "
3815  "active **\n\n");
3816  return false;
3817  }
3818  // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
3819  return ((info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0);
3820  }
3821 #elif DOCTEST_MSVC || defined(__MINGW32__)
3822  bool isDebuggerActive() { return ::IsDebuggerPresent() != 0; }
3823 #else
3824  bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
3825 #endif // Platform

3867  // steal the contents of the other - acting as a move constructor...
3868  ContextBuilder::ContextBuilder(ContextBuilder& other)
3869  : numCaptures(other.numCaptures)
3870  , head(other.head)
3871  , tail(other.tail) {
3872  other.numCaptures = 0;
3873  other.head = nullptr;
3874  other.tail = nullptr;
3875  memcpy(stackChunks, other.stackChunks,
3876  unsigned(int(sizeof(Chunk)) * DOCTEST_CONFIG_NUM_CAPTURES_ON_STACK));
3877  }
3878 
3879  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wcast-align")
3880  void ContextBuilder::stringify(std::ostream* s) const {
3881  int curr = 0;
3882  // iterate over small buffer
3883  while(curr < numCaptures && curr < DOCTEST_CONFIG_NUM_CAPTURES_ON_STACK)
3884  reinterpret_cast<const ICapture*>(stackChunks[curr++].buf)->toStream(s);
3885  // iterate over list
3886  auto curr_elem = head;
3887  while(curr < numCaptures) {
3888  reinterpret_cast<const ICapture*>(curr_elem->chunk.buf)->toStream(s);
3889  curr_elem = curr_elem->next;
3890  ++curr;
3891  }
3892  }
3893  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
3894 
3895  ContextBuilder::ContextBuilder() = default;
3896 
3897  ContextBuilder::~ContextBuilder() {
3898  // free the linked list - the ones on the stack are left as-is
3899  // no destructors are called at all - there is no need
3900  while(head) {
3901  auto next = head->next;
3902  delete head;
3903  head = next;
3904  }
3905  }

3913  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
3914  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
3915  ContextScope::~ContextScope() {

3917  std::ostringstream s;
3918  this->stringify(&s);
3919  g_cs->stringifiedContexts.push_back(s.str().c_str());
3920  }
3921  g_infoContexts.pop_back();
3922  }

3931 #if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS) && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH)

3933  {
3934  void reset() {}
3935  };

3937 
3938  void reportFatal(const std::string&);
3939 
3940 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
3941 
3942  struct SignalDefs
3943  {
3944  DWORD id;
3945  const char* name;
3946  };
3947  // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
3948  // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
3949  // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
3950  SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
3951  {EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION, "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal"},
3952  {EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW, "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow"},
3953  {EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal"},
3954  {EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO, "Divide by zero error"},
3955  };
3956 
3957  struct FatalConditionHandler
3958  {
3959  static LONG CALLBACK handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
3960  for(size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
3961  if(ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == signalDefs[i].id) {
3962  reportFatal(signalDefs[i].name);
3963  }
3964  }
3965  // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
3966  // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
3967  return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
3968  }
3969 
3970  FatalConditionHandler() {
3971  isSet = true;
3972  // 32k seems enough for doctest to handle stack overflow,
3973  // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
3974  guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
3975  exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
3976  // Register as first handler in current chain
3977  exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
3978  // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
3979  SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
3980  }
3981 
3982  static void reset() {
3983  if(isSet) {
3984  // Unregister handler and restore the old guarantee
3985  RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle);
3986  SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
3987  exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
3988  isSet = false;
3989  }
3990  }
3991 
3992  ~FatalConditionHandler() { reset(); }
3993 
3994  private:
3995  static bool isSet;
3996  static ULONG guaranteeSize;
3997  static PVOID exceptionHandlerHandle;
3998  };
3999 
4000  bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
4001  ULONG FatalConditionHandler::guaranteeSize = 0;
4002  PVOID FatalConditionHandler::exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
4003 
4004 #else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4005 
4006  struct SignalDefs
4007  {
4008  int id;
4009  const char* name;
4010  };
4011  SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {{SIGINT, "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal"},
4012  {SIGILL, "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal"},
4013  {SIGFPE, "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal"},
4014  {SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal"},
4015  {SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal"},
4016  {SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal"}};
4017 
4018  struct FatalConditionHandler
4019  {
4020  static bool isSet;
4021  static struct sigaction oldSigActions[DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs)];
4022  static stack_t oldSigStack;
4023  static char altStackMem[4 * SIGSTKSZ];
4024 
4025  static void handleSignal(int sig) {
4026  const char* name = "<unknown signal>";
4027  for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
4028  SignalDefs& def = signalDefs[i];
4029  if(sig == def.id) {
4030  name = def.name;
4031  break;
4032  }
4033  }
4034  reset();
4035  reportFatal(name);
4036  raise(sig);
4037  }
4038 
4039  FatalConditionHandler() {
4040  isSet = true;
4041  stack_t sigStack;
4042  sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
4043  sigStack.ss_size = sizeof(altStackMem);
4044  sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
4045  sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
4046  struct sigaction sa = {nullptr};
4047 
4048  sa.sa_handler = handleSignal; // NOLINT
4049  sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
4050  for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
4051  sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
4052  }
4053  }
4054 
4055  ~FatalConditionHandler() { reset(); }
4056  static void reset() {
4057  if(isSet) {
4058  // Set signals back to previous values -- hopefully nobody overwrote them in the meantime
4059  for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
4060  sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], nullptr);
4061  }
4062  // Return the old stack
4063  sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, nullptr);
4064  isSet = false;
4065  }
4066  }
4067  };
4068 
4069  bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
4070  struct sigaction FatalConditionHandler::oldSigActions[DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs)] = {};
4071  stack_t FatalConditionHandler::oldSigStack = {};
4072  char FatalConditionHandler::altStackMem[] = {};
4073 
4074 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4075 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS || DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
4076 
4077 } // namespace
4078

4080  using namespace detail;

4082 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4083 #define DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(text) ::OutputDebugStringA(text)
4084 #else
4085  // TODO: integration with XCode and other IDEs
4086 #define DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(text)
4087 #endif // Platform

4089  void addAssert(assertType::Enum at) {
4090  if((at & assertType::is_warn) == 0)
4091  g_cs->numAssertsForCurrentTestCase_atomic++;
4092  }
4093 
4094  void addFailedAssert(assertType::Enum at) {
4095  if((at & assertType::is_warn) == 0)
4096  g_cs->numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase_atomic++;
4097  }
4098 
4099 #if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS) || defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH)
4100  void reportFatal(const std::string& message) {
4101  g_cs->seconds_so_far += g_timer.getElapsedSeconds();
4102  g_cs->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Crash;
4103  g_cs->error_string = message.c_str();
4104  g_cs->should_reenter = false;
4105 
4106  // TODO: end all currently opened subcases...?
4107 
4108  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
4109 
4110  g_cs->numTestCasesFailed++;
4111 
4112  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_end, *g_cs);
4113  }
4114 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS || DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
4115 } // namespace

4147  bool ResultBuilder::log() {
4148  if(m_at & assertType::is_throws) {
4149  m_failed = !m_threw;
4150  } else if(m_at & assertType::is_throws_as) {
4151  m_failed = !m_threw_as;
4152  } else if(m_at & assertType::is_nothrow) {
4153  m_failed = m_threw;
4154  }
4155 
4156  if(is_running_in_test) {
4157  addAssert(m_at);
4158  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(log_assert, *this);
4159 
4160  if(m_failed)
4161  addFailedAssert(m_at);
4162  } else if(m_failed) {
4163  failed_out_of_a_testing_context(*this);
4164  }
4165 
4166  return m_failed && isDebuggerActive() &&
4167  !getContextOptions()->no_breaks; // break into debugger
4168  }
4169 
4170  void ResultBuilder::react() const {
4171  if(m_failed && checkIfShouldThrow(m_at))
4172  throwException();
4173  }
4174 
4175  void failed_out_of_a_testing_context(const AssertData& ad) {
4176  if(g_cs->ah)
4177  g_cs->ah(ad);
4178  else
4179  std::abort();
4180  }

4192  bool MessageBuilder::log() {
4193  m_string = getTlsOssResult();
4194  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(log_message, *this);
4195 
4196  const bool isWarn = m_severity & assertType::is_warn;
4197 
4198  // warn is just a message in this context so we dont treat it as an assert
4199  if(!isWarn) {
4200  addAssert(m_severity);
4201  addFailedAssert(m_severity);
4202  }
4203 
4204  return isDebuggerActive() && !getContextOptions()->no_breaks && !isWarn; // break
4205  }

4209  throwException();

4235  void separator_to_stream() {
4236  s << Color::Yellow
4237  << "============================================================================="
4238  "=="
4239  "\n";
4240  }
4241 
4242  void file_line_to_stream(const char* file, int line, const char* tail = "") {
4243  s << Color::LightGrey << removePathFromFilename(file)
4244  << (opt->gnu_file_line ? ":" : "(")
4245  << (opt->no_line_numbers ? 0 : line) // 0 or the real num depending on the option
4246  << (opt->gnu_file_line ? ":" : "):") << tail;
4247  }
4248 
4249  const char* getSuccessOrFailString(bool success, assertType::Enum at,
4250  const char* success_str) {
4251  if(success)
4252  return success_str;
4253  return failureString(at);
4254  }
4255 
4256  Color::Enum getSuccessOrFailColor(bool success, assertType::Enum at) {
4257  return success ? Color::BrightGreen :
4258  (at & assertType::is_warn) ? Color::Yellow : Color::Red;
4259  }
4260

4262  const char* success_str = "SUCCESS: ") {
4263  s << getSuccessOrFailColor(success, at)
4264  << getSuccessOrFailString(success, at, success_str);
4265  }
4266 
4267  void log_contexts() {
4268  int num_contexts = get_num_active_contexts();
4269  if(num_contexts) {
4270  auto contexts = get_active_contexts();
4271 
4272  s << Color::None << " logged: ";
4273  for(int i = 0; i < num_contexts; ++i) {
4274  s << (i == 0 ? "" : " ");
4275  contexts[i]->stringify(&s);
4276  s << "\n";
4277  }
4278  }
4279 
4280  s << "\n";
4281  }
4282 
4283  void logTestStart() {
4284  if(hasLoggedCurrentTestStart)
4285  return;
4286 
4287  separator_to_stream();
4288  file_line_to_stream(tc->m_file, tc->m_line, "\n");
4289  if(tc->m_description)
4290  s << Color::Yellow << "DESCRIPTION: " << Color::None << tc->m_description << "\n";
4291  if(tc->m_test_suite && tc->m_test_suite[0] != '\0')
4292  s << Color::Yellow << "TEST SUITE: " << Color::None << tc->m_test_suite << "\n";
4293  if(strncmp(tc->m_name, " Scenario:", 11) != 0)
4294  s << Color::None << "TEST CASE: ";
4295  s << Color::None << tc->m_name << "\n";
4296 
4297  for(auto& curr : subcasesStack)
4298  if(curr.m_name[0] != '\0')
4299  s << " " << curr.m_name << "\n";
4300 
4301  s << "\n";
4302 
4303  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = true;
4304  }

4310  void test_run_start(const ContextOptions& o) override { opt = &o; }
4311 
4312  void test_run_end(const TestRunStats& p) override {
4313  separator_to_stream();
4314 
4315  const bool anythingFailed = p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 || p.numAssertsFailed > 0;
4316  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "test cases: " << std::setw(6)
4317  << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters << " | "
4318  << ((p.numTestCasesPassingFilters == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None :
4319  Color::Green)
4320  << std::setw(6) << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed << " passed"
4321  << Color::None << " | " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None)
4322  << std::setw(6) << p.numTestCasesFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " | ";
4323  if(opt->no_skipped_summary == false) {
4324  const int numSkipped = p.numTestCases - p.numTestCasesPassingFilters;
4325  s << (numSkipped == 0 ? Color::None : Color::Yellow) << std::setw(6) << numSkipped
4326  << " skipped" << Color::None;
4327  }
4328  s << "\n";
4329  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "assertions: " << std::setw(6)
4330  << p.numAsserts << " | "
4331  << ((p.numAsserts == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None : Color::Green)
4332  << std::setw(6) << (p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed) << " passed" << Color::None
4333  << " | " << (p.numAssertsFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None) << std::setw(6)
4334  << p.numAssertsFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " |\n";
4335  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
4336  << "Status: " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::Green)
4337  << ((p.numTestCasesFailed > 0) ? "FAILURE!\n" : "SUCCESS!\n") << Color::None;
4338  }
4339 
4340  void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
4341  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
4342  tc = &in;
4343  }
4344 
4345  void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats& st) override {
4346  // log the preamble of the test case only if there is something
4347  // else to print - something other than that an assert has failed
4348  if(opt->duration ||
4349  (st.failure_flags && st.failure_flags != TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure))
4350  logTestStart();
4351 
4352  // report test case exceptions and crashes
4353  bool crashed = st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::Crash;
4354  if(crashed || (st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::Exception)) {
4355  file_line_to_stream(tc->m_file, tc->m_line, " ");
4356  successOrFailColoredStringToStream(false, crashed ? assertType::is_require :
4357  assertType::is_check);
4358  s << Color::Red << (crashed ? "test case CRASHED: " : "test case THREW exception: ")
4359  << Color::Cyan << st.error_string << "\n";
4360 
4361  int num_stringified_contexts = get_num_stringified_contexts();
4362  if(num_stringified_contexts) {
4363  auto stringified_contexts = get_stringified_contexts();
4364  s << Color::None << " logged: ";
4365  for(int i = num_stringified_contexts - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
4366  s << (i == num_stringified_contexts - 1 ? "" : " ")
4367  << stringified_contexts[i] << "\n";
4368  }
4369  }
4370  s << "\n";
4371  }
4372 
4373  // means the test case will be re-entered because there are untraversed (but discovered) subcases
4374  if(st.should_reenter)
4375  return;
4376 
4377  if(opt->duration)
4378  s << Color::None << std::setprecision(6) << std::fixed << st.seconds_so_far
4379  << " s: " << tc->m_name << "\n";
4380 
4381  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::Timeout)
4382  s << Color::Red << "Test case exceeded time limit of " << std::setprecision(6)
4383  << std::fixed << tc->m_timeout << "!\n";
4384 
4385  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt) {
4386  s << Color::Red << "Should have failed but didn't! Marking it as failed!\n";
4387  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
4388  s << Color::Yellow << "Failed as expected so marking it as not failed\n";
4389  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
4390  s << Color::Yellow << "Allowed to fail so marking it as not failed\n";
4391  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::DidntFailExactlyNumTimes) {
4392  s << Color::Red << "Didn't fail exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
4393  << " times so marking it as failed!\n";
4394  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes) {
4395  s << Color::Yellow << "Failed exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
4396  << " times as expected so marking it as not failed!\n";
4397  }
4398  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts) {
4399  s << Color::Red << "Aborting - too many failed asserts!\n";
4400  }
4401  s << Color::None;
4402  }
4403 
4404  void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& subc) override {
4405  subcasesStack.push_back(subc);
4406  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
4407  }
4408 
4409  void subcase_end(const SubcaseSignature& /*subc*/) override {
4410  subcasesStack.pop_back();
4411  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
4412  }
4413 
4414  void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
4415  if(!rb.m_failed && !opt->success)
4416  return;
4417 
4418  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(g_mutex);
4419 
4420  logTestStart();
4421 
4422  file_line_to_stream(rb.m_file, rb.m_line, " ");
4423  successOrFailColoredStringToStream(!rb.m_failed, rb.m_at);
4424  if((rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_as) == 0)
4425  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << " ) "
4426  << Color::None;
4427 
4428  if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws) {
4429  s << (rb.m_threw ? "threw as expected!" : "did NOT throw at all!") << "\n";
4430  } else if(rb.m_at &
4431  assertType::is_throws_as) {
4432  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", "
4433  << rb.m_exception_type << " ) " << Color::None
4434  << (rb.m_threw ? (rb.m_threw_as ? "threw as expected!" :
4435  "threw a DIFFERENT exception: ") :
4436  "did NOT throw at all!")
4437  << Color::Cyan << rb.m_exception << "\n";
4438  } else if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_nothrow) {
4439  s << (rb.m_threw ? "THREW exception: " : "didn't throw!") << Color::Cyan
4440  << rb.m_exception << "\n";
4441  } else {
4442  s << (rb.m_threw ? "THREW exception: " :
4443  (!rb.m_failed ? "is correct!\n" : "is NOT correct!\n"));
4444  if(rb.m_threw)
4445  s << rb.m_exception << "\n";
4446  else
4447  s << " values: " << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_decomp << " )\n";
4448  }
4449 
4450  log_contexts();
4451  }
4452 
4453  void log_message(const MessageData& mb) override {
4454  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(g_mutex);
4455 
4456  logTestStart();
4457 
4458  file_line_to_stream(mb.m_file, mb.m_line, " ");
4459  s << getSuccessOrFailColor(false, mb.m_severity)
4460  << getSuccessOrFailString(mb.m_severity & assertType::is_warn, mb.m_severity,
4461  "MESSAGE: ");
4462  s << Color::None << mb.m_string << "\n";
4463  log_contexts();
4464  }
4465 
4466  void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) override {}
4467  };

4544  s << " -nb, --no-breaks=<bool> disables breakpoints in debuggers\n";
4545  s << " -ns, --no-skip=<bool> don't skip test cases marked as skip\n";
4546  s << " -gfl, --gnu-file-line=<bool> :n: vs (n): for line numbers in output\n";
4547  s << " -npf, --no-path-filenames=<bool> only filenames and no paths in output\n";
4548  s << " -nln, --no-line-numbers=<bool> 0 instead of real line numbers in output\n";
4549  // ================================================================================== << 79

4551

4629  // the implementation of parseFlag()
4630  bool parseFlagImpl(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern) {
4631  for(int i = argc - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
4632  auto temp = std::strstr(argv[i], pattern);
4633  if(temp && strlen(temp) == strlen(pattern)) {
4634  // eliminate strings in which the chars before the option are not '-'
4635  bool noBadCharsFound = true;
4636  while(temp != argv[i]) {
4637  if(*--temp != '-') {
4638  noBadCharsFound = false;
4639  break;
4640  }
4641  }
4642  if(noBadCharsFound && argv[i][0] == '-')
4643  return true;
4644  }
4645  }
4646  return false;
4647  }
4648 
4649  // locates a flag on the command line
4650  bool parseFlag(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern) {
4651 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
4652  if(parseFlagImpl(argc, argv, pattern + 3)) // 3 to skip "dt-"
4653  return true;
4654 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
4655  return parseFlagImpl(argc, argv, pattern);
4656  }
4657 
4658  // the implementation of parseOption()
4659  bool parseOptionImpl(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String& res) {
4660  for(int i = argc - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
4661  auto temp = std::strstr(argv[i], pattern);
4662  if(temp) {
4663  // eliminate matches in which the chars before the option are not '-'
4664  bool noBadCharsFound = true;
4665  auto curr = argv[i];
4666  while(curr != temp) {
4667  if(*curr++ != '-') {
4668  noBadCharsFound = false;
4669  break;
4670  }
4671  }
4672  if(noBadCharsFound && argv[i][0] == '-') {
4673  temp += strlen(pattern);
4674  const unsigned len = strlen(temp);
4675  if(len) {
4676  res = temp;
4677  return true;
4678  }
4679  }
4680  }
4681  }
4682  return false;
4683  }
4684 
4685  // parses an option and returns the string after the '=' character
4686  bool parseOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String& res,
4687  const String& defaultVal = String()) {
4688  res = defaultVal;
4689 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
4690  if(parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern + 3, res)) // 3 to skip "dt-"
4691  return true;
4692 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
4693  return parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern, res);
4694  }
4695 
4696  // parses a comma separated list of words after a pattern in one of the arguments in argv
4697  bool parseCommaSepArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern,
4698  std::vector<String>& res) {
4699  String filtersString;
4700  if(parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, filtersString)) {
4701  // tokenize with "," as a separator
4702  // cppcheck-suppress strtokCalled
4703  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
4704  auto pch = std::strtok(filtersString.c_str(), ","); // modifies the string
4705  while(pch != nullptr) {
4706  if(strlen(pch))
4707  res.push_back(pch);
4708  // uses the strtok() internal state to go to the next token
4709  // cppcheck-suppress strtokCalled
4710  pch = std::strtok(nullptr, ",");
4711  }
4712  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
4713  return true;
4714  }
4715  return false;
4716  }
4717 
4718  enum optionType
4719  {
4720  option_bool,
4721  option_int
4722  };
4723 
4724  // parses an int/bool option from the command line
4725  bool parseIntOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, optionType type,
4726  int& res) {
4727  String parsedValue;
4728  if(!parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, parsedValue))
4729  return false;
4730 
4731  if(type == 0) {
4732  // boolean
4733  const char positive[][5] = {"1", "true", "on", "yes"}; // 5 - strlen("true") + 1
4734  const char negative[][6] = {"0", "false", "off", "no"}; // 6 - strlen("false") + 1
4735 
4736  // if the value matches any of the positive/negative possibilities
4737  for(unsigned i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
4738  if(parsedValue.compare(positive[i], true) == 0) {
4739  res = 1;
4740  return true;
4741  }
4742  if(parsedValue.compare(negative[i], true) == 0) {
4743  res = 0;
4744  return true;
4745  }
4746  }
4747  } else {
4748  // integer
4749  // TODO: change this to use std::stoi or something else! currently it uses undefined behavior - assumes '0' on unsuccessful parse...
4750  int theInt = std::atoi(parsedValue.c_str()); // NOLINT
4751  if(theInt != 0) {
4752  res = theInt;
4753  return true;
4754  }
4755  }
4756  return false;
4757  }
4758 } // namespace

4773 // parses args
4774 void Context::parseArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, bool withDefaults) {
4775  using namespace detail;
4776 
4777  // clang-format off
4778  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-source-file=", p->filters[0]);
4779  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-sf=", p->filters[0]);
4780  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-source-file-exclude=",p->filters[1]);
4781  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-sfe=", p->filters[1]);
4782  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-test-suite=", p->filters[2]);
4783  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-ts=", p->filters[2]);
4784  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-test-suite-exclude=", p->filters[3]);
4785  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-tse=", p->filters[3]);
4786  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-test-case=", p->filters[4]);
4787  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-tc=", p->filters[4]);
4788  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-test-case-exclude=", p->filters[5]);
4789  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-tce=", p->filters[5]);
4790  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-subcase=", p->filters[6]);
4791  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-sc=", p->filters[6]);
4792  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-subcase-exclude=", p->filters[7]);
4793  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-sce=", p->filters[7]);
4794  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-reporters=", p->filters[8]);
4795  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, "dt-r=", p->filters[8]);
4796  // clang-format on
4797 
4798  int intRes = 0;
4799  String strRes;
4800 
4801 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG(name, sname, var, default) \
4802  if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, name "=", option_bool, intRes) || \
4803  parseIntOption(argc, argv, sname "=", option_bool, intRes)) \
4804  p->var = !!intRes; \
4805  else if(parseFlag(argc, argv, name) || parseFlag(argc, argv, sname)) \
4806  p->var = true; \
4807  else if(withDefaults) \
4808  p->var = default
4809 
4810 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
4811  if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, name "=", option_int, intRes) || \
4812  parseIntOption(argc, argv, sname "=", option_int, intRes)) \
4813  p->var = intRes; \
4814  else if(withDefaults) \
4815  p->var = default
4816 
4817 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
4818  if(parseOption(argc, argv, name "=", strRes, default) || \
4819  parseOption(argc, argv, sname "=", strRes, default) || withDefaults) \
4820  p->var = strRes
4821 
4822  // clang-format off
4823  DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("dt-order-by", "dt-ob", order_by, "file");
4824  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("dt-rand-seed", "dt-rs", rand_seed, 0);
4825 
4826  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("dt-first", "dt-f", first, 0);
4827  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("dt-last", "dt-l", last, UINT_MAX);
4828 
4829  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("dt-abort-after", "dt-aa", abort_after, 0);
4830  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("dt-subcase-filter-levels", "dt-scfl", subcase_filter_levels, 2000000000);
4831 
4832  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-success", "dt-s", success, false);
4833  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-case-sensitive", "dt-cs", case_sensitive, false);
4834  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-exit", "dt-e", exit, false);
4835  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-duration", "dt-d", duration, false);
4836  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-throw", "dt-nt", no_throw, false);
4837  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-exitcode", "dt-ne", no_exitcode, false);
4838  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-run", "dt-nr", no_run, false);
4839  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-version", "dt-nv", no_version, false);
4840  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-colors", "dt-nc", no_colors, false);
4841  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-force-colors", "dt-fc", force_colors, false);
4842  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-breaks", "dt-nb", no_breaks, false);
4843  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-skip", "dt-ns", no_skip, false);
4844  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-gnu-file-line", "dt-gfl", gnu_file_line, !bool(DOCTEST_MSVC));
4845  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-path-filenames", "dt-npf", no_path_in_filenames, false);
4846  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-line-numbers", "dt-nln", no_line_numbers, false);
4847  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("dt-no-skipped-summary", "dt-nss", no_skipped_summary, false);
4848  // clang-format on
4849 
4850  if(withDefaults) {
4851  p->help = false;
4852  p->version = false;
4853  p->count = false;
4854  p->list_test_cases = false;
4855  p->list_test_suites = false;
4856  p->list_reporters = false;
4857  }
4858  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-help") || parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-h") ||
4859  parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-?")) {
4860  p->help = true;
4861  p->exit = true;
4862  }
4863  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-version") || parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-v")) {
4864  p->version = true;
4865  p->exit = true;
4866  }
4867  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-count") || parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-c")) {
4868  p->count = true;
4869  p->exit = true;
4870  }
4871  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-list-test-cases") || parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-ltc")) {
4872  p->list_test_cases = true;
4873  p->exit = true;
4874  }
4875  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-list-test-suites") || parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-lts")) {
4876  p->list_test_suites = true;
4877  p->exit = true;
4878  }
4879  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-list-reporters") || parseFlag(argc, argv, "dt-lr")) {
4880  p->list_reporters = true;
4881  p->exit = true;
4882  }
4883 }
