4913 // the main function that does all the filtering and test running
4914 int Context::run() {
4915  using namespace detail;
4916 
4917  auto old_cs = g_cs;
4918  g_cs = p;
4919  is_running_in_test = true;
4920  g_no_colors = p->no_colors;
4921  p->resetRunData();
4922 
4923  ConsoleReporterWithHelpers g_con_rep(std::cout);
4924  registerReporter("console", 0, g_con_rep);
4925 
4926  // setup default reporter if none is given through the command line
4927  p->reporters_currently_used.clear();
4928  if(p->filters[8].empty())
4929  p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(getReporters()[reporterMap::key_type(0, "console")]);
4930 
4931  // check to see if any of the registered reporters has been selected
4932  for(auto& curr : getReporters()) {
4933  if(matchesAny(curr.first.second.c_str(), p->filters[8], false, p->case_sensitive))
4934  p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(curr.second);
4935  }
4936 
4937  // always use the debug output window reporter
4938 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4939  if(isDebuggerActive())
4940  p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(&g_debug_output_rep);
4941 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4942 
4943  // handle version, help and no_run
4944  if(p->no_run || p->version || p->help || p->list_reporters) {
4945  if(p->version)
4946  g_con_rep.printVersion();
4947  if(p->help)
4948  g_con_rep.printHelp();
4949  if(p->list_reporters)
4950  g_con_rep.printRegisteredReporters();
4951 
4952  g_cs = old_cs;
4953  is_running_in_test = false;
4954 
4955  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
4956  }
4957 
4958  g_con_rep.printIntro();
4959 
4960  std::vector<const TestCase*> testArray;
4961  for(auto& curr : getRegisteredTests())
4962  testArray.push_back(&curr);
4963  p->numTestCases = testArray.size();
4964 
4965  // sort the collected records
4966  if(!testArray.empty()) {
4967  if(p->order_by.compare("file", true) == 0) {
4968  std::qsort(&testArray[0], testArray.size(), sizeof(TestCase*), fileOrderComparator);
4969  } else if(p->order_by.compare("suite", true) == 0) {
4970  std::qsort(&testArray[0], testArray.size(), sizeof(TestCase*), suiteOrderComparator);
4971  } else if(p->order_by.compare("name", true) == 0) {
4972  std::qsort(&testArray[0], testArray.size(), sizeof(TestCase*), nameOrderComparator);
4973  } else if(p->order_by.compare("rand", true) == 0) {
4974  std::srand(p->rand_seed);
4975 
4976  // random_shuffle implementation
4977  const auto first = &testArray[0];
4978  for(size_t i = testArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i) {
4979  int idxToSwap = std::rand() % (i + 1); // NOLINT
4980 
4981  const auto temp = first[i];
4982 
4983  first[i] = first[idxToSwap];
4984  first[idxToSwap] = temp;
4985  }
4986  }
4987  }
4988 
4989  if(p->list_test_cases)
4990  g_con_rep.output_query_preamble_test_cases();
4991 
4992  std::set<String> testSuitesPassingFilt;
4993  if(p->list_test_suites)
4994  g_con_rep.output_query_preamble_test_suites();
4995 
4996  bool query_mode = p->count || p->list_test_cases || p->list_test_suites;
4997 
4998  if(!query_mode)
4999  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_start, *g_cs);
5000 
5001  // invoke the registered functions if they match the filter criteria (or just count them)
5002  for(auto& curr : testArray) {
5003  const auto tc = *curr;
5004 
5005  bool skip_me = false;
5006  if(tc.m_skip && !p->no_skip)
5007  skip_me = true;
5008 
5009  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_file, p->filters[0], true, p->case_sensitive))
5010  skip_me = true;
5011  if(matchesAny(tc.m_file, p->filters[1], false, p->case_sensitive))
5012  skip_me = true;
5013  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[2], true, p->case_sensitive))
5014  skip_me = true;
5015  if(matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[3], false, p->case_sensitive))
5016  skip_me = true;
5017  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[4], true, p->case_sensitive))
5018  skip_me = true;
5019  if(matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[5], false, p->case_sensitive))
5020  skip_me = true;
5021 
5022  if(!skip_me)
5023  p->numTestCasesPassingFilters++;
5024 
5025  // skip the test if it is not in the execution range
5026  if((p->last < p->numTestCasesPassingFilters && p->first <= p->last) ||
5027  (p->first > p->numTestCasesPassingFilters))
5028  skip_me = true;
5029 
5030  if(skip_me) {
5031  if(!query_mode)
5032  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_skipped, tc);
5033  continue;
5034  }
5035 
5036  // do not execute the test if we are to only count the number of filter passing tests
5037  if(p->count)
5038  continue;
5039 
5040  // print the name of the test and don't execute it
5041  if(p->list_test_cases) {
5042  g_con_rep.output_c_string_with_newline(tc.m_name);
5043  continue;
5044  }
5045 
5046  // print the name of the test suite if not done already and don't execute it
5047  if(p->list_test_suites) {
5048  if((testSuitesPassingFilt.count(tc.m_test_suite) == 0) && tc.m_test_suite[0] != '\0') {
5049  g_con_rep.output_c_string_with_newline(tc.m_test_suite);
5050  testSuitesPassingFilt.insert(tc.m_test_suite);
5051  p->numTestSuitesPassingFilters++;
5052  }
5053  continue;
5054  }
5055 
5056  // execute the test if it passes all the filtering
5057  {
5058  p->currentTest = &tc;
5059 
5060  p->failure_flags = TestCaseFailureReason::None;
5061  p->seconds_so_far = 0;
5062  p->error_string = "";
5063 
5064  // reset non-atomic counters
5065  p->numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase = 0;
5066  p->numAssertsForCurrentTestCase = 0;
5067 
5068  p->subcasesPassed.clear();
5069  do {
5070  // reset some of the fields for subcases (except for the set of fully passed ones)
5071  p->should_reenter = false;
5072  p->subcasesCurrentLevel = 0;
5073  p->subcasesEnteredLevels.clear();
5074 
5075  // reset stuff for logging with INFO()
5076  p->stringifiedContexts.clear();
5077 
5078  // reset atomic counters
5079  p->numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase_atomic = 0;
5080  p->numAssertsForCurrentTestCase_atomic = 0;
5081 
5082  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_start, tc);
5083 
5084  g_timer.start();
5085 
5086 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5087  try {
5088 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5089  FatalConditionHandler fatalConditionHandler; // Handle signals
5090  // execute the test
5091  tc.m_test();
5092  fatalConditionHandler.reset();
5093 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5094  } catch(const TestFailureException&) {
5095  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
5096  } catch(...) {
5097  p->error_string = translateActiveException();
5098  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Exception;
5099  }
5100 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5101 
5102  p->seconds_so_far += g_timer.getElapsedSeconds();
5103 
5104  // update the non-atomic counters
5105  p->numAsserts += p->numAssertsForCurrentTestCase_atomic;
5106  p->numAssertsForCurrentTestCase += p->numAssertsForCurrentTestCase_atomic;
5107  p->numAssertsFailed += p->numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase_atomic;
5108  p->numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase +=
5109  p->numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase_atomic;
5110 
5111  // exit this loop if enough assertions have failed - even if there are more subcases
5112  if(p->abort_after > 0 && p->numAssertsFailed >= p->abort_after) {
5113  p->should_reenter = false;
5114  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts;
5115  }
5116 
5117  // call it from here only if we will continue looping for other subcases and
5118  // call it again outside of the loop for one final time - with updated flags
5119  if(p->should_reenter == true) {
5120  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
5121  // remove these flags - it is expected that the reporters have handled these issues
5122  p->failure_flags &= ~TestCaseFailureReason::Exception;
5123  p->failure_flags &= ~TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
5124  }
5125  } while(p->should_reenter == true);
5126 
5127  if(p->numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase)
5128  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
5129 
5130  if(Approx(p->currentTest->m_timeout).epsilon(DBL_EPSILON) != 0 &&
5131  Approx(p->seconds_so_far).epsilon(DBL_EPSILON) > p->currentTest->m_timeout)
5132  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Timeout;
5133 
5134  if(tc.m_should_fail) {
5135  if(p->failure_flags) {
5136  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid;
5137  } else {
5138  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt;
5139  }
5140  } else if(p->failure_flags && tc.m_may_fail) {
5141  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid;
5142  } else if(tc.m_expected_failures > 0) {
5143  if(p->numAssertsFailedForCurrentTestCase == tc.m_expected_failures) {
5144  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes;
5145  } else {
5146  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::DidntFailExactlyNumTimes;
5147  }
5148  }
5149 
5150  bool ok_to_fail = (TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid & p->failure_flags) ||
5151  (TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid & p->failure_flags) ||
5152  (TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes & p->failure_flags);
5153 
5154  // if any subcase has failed - the whole test case has failed
5155  if(p->failure_flags && !ok_to_fail)
5156  p->numTestCasesFailed++;
5157 
5158  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
5159 
5160  p->currentTest = nullptr;
5161 
5162  // stop executing tests if enough assertions have failed
5163  if(p->abort_after > 0 && p->numAssertsFailed >= p->abort_after)
5164  break;
5165  }
5166  }
5167 
5168  if(!query_mode)
5169  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_end, *g_cs);
5170  else
5171  g_con_rep.output_query_results();
5172 
5173  g_cs = old_cs;
5174  is_running_in_test = false;
5175 
5176  if(p->numTestCasesFailed && !p->no_exitcode)
5177  return EXIT_FAILURE;
5178  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
5179 }
